definition: snail/Taiwan pr. [gua1]/see 蝸牛|蜗牛[wo1 niu2]
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
fig. people who cannot afford to buy their own house

sentences.english: Don't worry. It's a racing snail.
sentences.chinese: 不用麻煩，咱蝸牛速度賽過極品飛車。

sentences.english: There are countless people who, ever since their early years, have learned to associate snails with food.
sentences.chinese: 有不計其數的人從小就學會把蝸牛和喫食聯繫在一起。

sentences.english: Indeed, most snail removers are copper based.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，大多數蝸牛去除有銅爲基礎。

sentences.english: The snail drew in its horns.
He picks up the snail and throws it as far as he can.
sentences.chinese: 他拾起蝸牛，嗖的一下扔的老遠。

sentences.english: How many pounds of snails did you buy?
He is slower than a snail and uses a walkingstick.
sentences.chinese: 他行動起來比蝸牛還慢，總是拄着柺杖走路。

sentences.english: The larva takes aim at the snail's tentacles. It strikes with its poison nippers.
sentences.chinese: 小螢火蟲瞄準了蝸牛的觸角，並用自己帶毒的螯出擊。

sentences.english: Snails with the shells that you put on the table, fanciness.
sentences.chinese: 還有放在桌上的帶殼蝸牛，真有趣。

sentences.english: When he croaked, the water snails listened politely.
sentences.chinese: 當他叫時，水蝸牛禮貌地聽着。

sentences.english: Two snails were living on a back of the butterbur leaves.
sentences.chinese: 有兩隻蝸牛住在款冬葉子的背面。

sentences.english: This is the tale of tiny snail and a great big, grey-blue humpback whale.
sentences.chinese: 這是一隻小蝸牛和一隻巨大的藍灰色隆背鯨魚的故事。

sentences.english: One day, they found a little snail crying on the back of a butterbur leaf.
sentences.chinese: 有天，他們發現有隻小蝸牛在一片款冬葉子後哭。

sentences.english: A snail shrinks back at a touch.
The snail was the blue-haired fairy's pet.
sentences.chinese: 這隻蝸牛是藍髮仙女的寵物。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Congress had also become involved in the fate of the snail darter.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，國會也捲入了有關蝸牛鏢命運的膠葛之中。

definition: ground or first floor/bottom (of a pile)/lowest rung (of society)
